maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Monday November 2, 2020 at 18:01

did.abstract: Nancy E. Forsberg was born on August 5, 1922. She graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Denison University and later from Yale University School of Divinity. She was ordained in 1951. Rev. Nancy became pastor of the First Congregational Church in Union, New Jersey, in 1967. She was a leader in interfaith and interracial efforts in Union County. She served as the pastor of the First Congregational Church until her retirement in 2000. She died on April 5, 2008. This collection contains a single portrait of Nancy E. Forsburg created by an unknow artist in 1998.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: For both preservation and display purposes, this portrait has been framed. Framed portraits at the CLA will not be taken out of their frames without the express permission of the Library Director.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Nancy E. Forsberg portrait, 1998, MS5414. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by Mary Lou Mayfield in August, 2020; accession 2020-09.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Zachary Bodnar, November 2020 2016, using DACS second edition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Nancy E. Forsberg was born on August 5, 1922 in Jersey City and moved to Maplewood, New Jersey in 1926. She graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Denison University and worked as an educator in Ohio and worked at the YWCA In Connecticut. She graduated from Yale University School of Divinity in 1951 and was ordained the same year; she was one of only three women who graduated from the divinity school that year. She later graduated with a masters in education from New York University. She returned to Maplewood and became pastor of the First Congregational Church in Union, New Jersey, in 1967. While serving as pastor, Rev. Nancy became a leader in interfaith and interracial efforts; she is credited with helping to bring Holocaust studies into Union-area schools. She also led an interfaith Bus Ministry which brought groups of people on spiritually focused trips across the United States, Canada, Europe, and Israel. She served as the pastor of the First Congregational Church, now the Faith United Church of Christ, until her retirement in 2000. She died on April 5, 2008.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a single portrait of Nancy E. Forsburg. The portrait was created by an unknow artist in 1998. Portrait is, likely, charcoal on paper.

corpname.part: Faith United Church of Christ (Union (Union County, N.J.))
